message.content:
cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.CE

Reasoning: 
1. cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) - The paper discusses data transfer and scheduling in Grids, which falls under the domain of distributed computing. 
2. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The paper proposes a dynamic data replication strategy to improve data access efficiency, which involves designing and implementing algorithms for managing data. 
3. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) - The paper discusses the high latencies of Wide Area Networks and Internet, which are major bottlenecks in supporting fast data access in Grids. 
4. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a job scheduling policy and a dynamic data replication strategy to improve system performance. 
5. cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science) - The paper discusses the impact of data replication on job scheduling performance, which is relevant to computational science and engineering applications.
